body_html:
@sebderhy your root conda environment must've been Python 3.5. Subsequently, did you upgrade to Python 3.7 in a particular non-root conda environment? That's what I think might be the root cause.

Install Anaconda with python 3.7 and Cuda 9.2 on Ubuntu 16.04
Create a new environment
Check that python version is still 3.7

If you want to install a conda package in a new particular environment, you have to do:

conda install -n [environment-name] [package-name]

Hi @soumith

My root Anaconda environment is python 3.7 (see screenshots below). It was also 3.7 on the environment I created to install pytorch there. However, after installation, it got downgraded to 3.5.6.
